83bbfc02-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Total emission rate of ethene (C2H4) into the atmosphere

83bbfc01-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: This is the total emission rate of ethanol (C2H5OH) into the atmosphere

83bbfc00-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: This is the total emission rate of ethane (C2H6) into the atmosphere

83bbfbff-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: This is the total emission rate of propene (C3H6) into the atmosphere

83bbfbfe-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: This is the total emission rate of propane (C3H8) into the atmosphere

83bbfbfd-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: This is the total emission rate of butane (C4H10) into the atmosphere

83bbfbfc-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: This is the total emission rate of methanol (CH3OH) into the atmosphere

83bbfbfb-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: This is the total emission rate of methane (CH4) into the atmosphere

83bbfbfa-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: This is the total emission rate of molecular hydrogen (H2) into the atmosphere (i.e., integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field)

83bbfbf9-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: This is the emission rate of methane (CH4) into the atmosphere from freshwater lakes

83bbfbf8-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: This is the mole fraction of molecular hydrogen (H2) in air

83bbfbf7-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Loss of H2 due to chemical destruction
83bbfbf7-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: This is the loss rate of molecular hydrogen (H2) from the atmosphere due to chemical destruction

83bbfbf6-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: This is the production of molecular hydrogen (H2) in the atmosphere due to chemical production

baaeaf1e-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.long_name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of HCFC22
baaeaf1e-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen'. The chemical formula for HCFC22 is CHClF2.  The IUPAC name for HCFC22 is chloro-difluoro-methane.

83bbfbf5-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: The mean age of air is defined as the mean time that a stratospheric air mass has been out of contact with the well-mixed troposphere.

3a049b80-9c3a-11e6-8d5d-ac72891c3257.description: The mean age of air is defined as the mean time that a stratospheric air mass has been out of contact with the well-mixed troposphere.

19bfccbc-81b1-11e6-92de-ac72891c3257.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.   The chemical formula of  nitrous oxide is N2O.

bab2124e-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.   The chemical formula of  nitrous oxide is N2O.

fda67476-96ec-11e6-b81e-c9e268aff03a.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.   The chemical formula of  nitrous oxide is N2O.

bab221e4-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.long_name: Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O

a92e4ec6-817c-11e6-a4e2-5404a60d96b5.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.   The chemical formula of  nitrous oxide is N2O.

19bedbc2-81b1-11e6-92de-ac72891c3257.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

59fbf2a8-c77d-11e6-8a33-5404a60d96b5.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

fda70c24-96ec-11e6-b81e-c9e268aff03a.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

59fc01c6-c77d-11e6-8a33-5404a60d96b5.description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

83bbfbf4-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: This is the mole fraction of ozone in air, sampled on the first day of the month as an instantaneous field.

80ab72a7-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.long_name: Reference ozone mole fraction used in diagnostic call to radiation scheme
80ab72a7-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: This is the ozone mole fraction that is used in a diagnostic call to the model's radiation scheme. It is only applicable when an ozone double call is active in the model.

83bbfc2b-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Reference ozone mole fraction used in diagnostic call to radiation scheme
83bbfc2b-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: This is the ozone mole fraction that is used in a diagnostic call to the model's radiation scheme. It is only applicable when an ozone double call is active in the model.

fdb19130-96ec-11e6-b81e-c9e268aff03a.long_name: Stratospheric Ozone Tracer Volume Mixing Ratio
fdb19130-96ec-11e6-b81e-c9e268aff03a.description: Ozone tracer intended to map out strat-trop exchange (STE) of ozone.

83bbfbf3-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Top of atmosphere outgoing longwave radiative fluxes from diagnostic radiation call with reference methane
83bbfbf3-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: This is the outgoing longwave flux at the top-of-atmosphere for all-sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme using a reference methane field

83bbfbf2-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Top of atmosphere outgoing longwave radiative fluxes under clear sky conditions from diagnostic radiation call with reference methane
83bbfbf2-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: This is the outgoing longwave flux at the top-of-atmosphere for clear-sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme with a reference methane field

83bbfbf1-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Top of atmosphere outgoing longwave radiative flux under clear-sky conditions from diagnostic call to radiation scheme with a reference ozone field
83bbfbf1-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: This is the outgoing longwave flux at the top-of-atmosphere for clear-sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme using a reference ozone field

83bbfbf0-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Top of atmosphere longwave radiative flux from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme using a reference ozone field
83bbfbf0-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: This is outgoing longwave flux at the top-of-atmosphere for all-sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme using a reference ozone field

83bbfbef-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Top of atmosphere shortwave outgoing radiation from a diagnostic call with a reference methane field
83bbfbef-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: This is the outgoing shortwave flux at the top-of-atmosphere for all-sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme with a reference methane field

83bbfbee-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Top of atmosphere shortwave outgoing radiative flux under clear sky conditions from diagnostic radiation call with reference methane
83bbfbee-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: This is the outgoing shortwave flux at the top-of-atmosphere for clear-sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme with a reference methane field

83bbfbed-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Top of atmosphere shortwave radiative flux under clear sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme using a reference ozone field
83bbfbed-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: This represents the top-of-atmosphere outgoing shortwave radiative flux assuming clear-sky conditions when a reference ozone field is used in a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme

83bbfbec-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Top of atmosphere shortwave flux from diagnostic call to radiation scheme using a reference ozone field
83bbfbec-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: This is top-of-atmosphere outgoing shortwave flux for all-sky conditions from a diagnostic call to the radiation scheme, using a reference ozone field

83bbfbeb-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Loss of CH4 due to chemical destruction in the stratosphere
83bbfbeb-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: This is the loss rate of stratospheric methane by all chemical destruction. The distinction between the stratosphere and troposphere should be consistent with the tropopause as used in the calculation of the tropopause pressure (ptp). It should have zero values in the troposphere.

83bbfbe8-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Tropospheric loss of CH4 from chemical destruction
83bbfbe8-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: This is the loss rate of tropospheric methane by all chemical destruction. The distinction between stratosphere and troposphere should be consistent with the tropopause used in the calculation of the tropopause pressure (ptp).  It should have zero values in the stratosphere.

83bbfbe7-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Loss of CH4 due to tropospheric loss by OH
83bbfbe7-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: This is the loss rate of tropospheric methane due to reaction with the hydroxy (OH) radical. The distinction between stratosphere and troposphere should be consistent with the tropopause used to calculate the pressure of the tropopause (ptp).  It should have zero values in the stratosphere.

83bbfbe6-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Net Chemistry Tendency of O3 in troposphere
83bbfbe6-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: This is the net chemical tendency of ozone in the troposphere. The distinction between the stratosphere and troposphere should be consistent with the definition of the tropopause used in the calculation of the tropopause pressure (ptp). It should have zero values in the stratosphere.

83bbfbe5-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Tropospheric ozone volume mixing ratio due to stratosphere-troposphere exchange (STE)
83bbfbe5-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Ozone tracer intended to map out strat-trop exchange (STE) of ozone in the troposphere. It represents the ozone volume mixing ratio in the troposphere that is considered to be stratospheric in origin. It should be consistent with the definition of tropopause used to calculate the pressure of the tropopause (ptp). It should have zero values in the stratosphere and non-zero positive values in the troposphere.

83bbfbe4-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: This is the loss rate of nitric acid (HNO3) from the atmosphere due to wet deposition

83bbfc2f-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Daily Wet Deposition Rate of NH3 at surface. Vertically integrated throughout the column to the surface.

19be2a60-81b1-11e6-92de-ac72891c3257.description: Surface deposition rate of ammonia (NH3) due to wet processes

83bbfc2e-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Daily Wet Deposition Rate of NH4 at surface. Vertically integrated throughout the column to the surface.

19be22b8-81b1-11e6-92de-ac72891c3257.description: Surface deposition rate of ammonium (NH4) due to wet processes

83bbfbe3-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: This is the loss rate of nitrate aerosol from the atmosphere due to wet deposition

83bbfc2d-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Wet Deposition Rate of NOy Including Aerosol Nitrate
83bbfc2d-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Daily Wet Deposition Rate of NOy at surface. Vertically integrated throughout the column to the surface.

19beaf58-81b1-11e6-92de-ac72891c3257.long_name: Wet Deposition Rate of NOy Including Aerosol Nitrate
19beaf58-81b1-11e6-92de-ac72891c3257.description: NOy is the sum of all simulated oxidized nitrogen species, out of NO, NO2, HNO3, HNO4, NO3aerosol, NO3(radical), N2O5, PAN, other organic nitrates.

d5b3804a-c78d-11e6-9b25-5404a60d96b5.long_name: Grid-Cell Area for Ice Sheet Variables
d5b3804a-c78d-11e6-9b25-5404a60d96b5.description: Cell areas any grid used to report ice sheet variables. These cell areas should be defined to enable exact calculation of area integrals (e.g., of vertical fluxes of energy at the surface and top of the atmosphere)

d5b36dbc-c78d-11e6-9b25-5404a60d96b5.long_name: Grid-Cell Area for Ice Sheet Variables
d5b36dbc-c78d-11e6-9b25-5404a60d96b5.description: Cell areas any grid used to report ice sheet variables. These cell areas should be defined to enable exact calculation of area integrals (e.g., of vertical fluxes of energy at the surface and top of the atmosphere)

8306180c-76ca-11e7-ba39-ac72891c3257.long_name: Grid-Cell Area for River Model Variables
8306180c-76ca-11e7-ba39-ac72891c3257.description: Cell areas for any grid used to report river model variables (may be the same as for atmospheric variables). These cell areas should be defined to enable exact calculation of area integrals (e.g., of vertical fluxes of energy at the surface and top of the atmosphere).

baa84fd4-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by bare soil.

fb018658-be37-11e6-bac1-5404a60d96b5.description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by bare soil.

baa88256-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.long_name: Percentage of Entire Grid Cell That Is Covered by Burnt Vegetation (All Classes)
baa88256-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Percentage of grid cell burned due to all fires including natural and anthropogenic fires and those associated with anthropogenic land use change

8b7f725e-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Mass of 13C in All Terrestrial Carbon Pools
8b7f725e-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Carbon-13 mass content per unit area in vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass), litter (dead plant material in or above the soil), soil, and forestry and agricultural products (e.g. paper, cardboard, furniture, timber for construction, biofuels and food for both humans and livestock).

8b7f6728-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Carbon-13 mass content per unit area litter (dead plant material in or above the soil).

6f6af744-9acb-11e6-b7ee-ac72891c3257.description: Carbon-13 mass content per unit area in soil.

8b7f6192-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Carbon-13 mass content per unit area in vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass).

8b7f5bfc-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Mass of 14C in All Terrestrial Carbon Pools
8b7f5bfc-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Carbon-14 mass content per unit area in vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass), litter (dead plant material in or above the soil), soil, and forestry and agricultural products (e.g. paper, cardboard, furniture, timber for construction, biofuels and food for both humans and livestock).

8b7f5080-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Carbon-14 mass content per unit area litter (dead plant material in or above the soil).

8b7f5652-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Carbon-14 mass content per unit area in soil.

baa897e6-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.long_name: Percentage Cover by C3 Plant Functional Type
baa897e6-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by C3 PFTs (including grass, crops, and trees).

baa89f8e-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.long_name: Percentage Cover by C4 Plant Functional Type
baa89f8e-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by C4 PFTs (including grass and crops).

80ab72a0-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Mass of carbon that has been intentionally sequestered in geologic storage. The definition of geologic storage here is that it be stored for periods of time that are long as compared to the simulation.

8b7eded4-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Total Carbon in All Terrestrial Carbon Pools
8b7eded4-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

baa8aed4-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Carbon mass per unit area in leaves.

baa8b67c-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The sum of the quantities with standard names surface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon and subsurface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon has the standard name litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon.

8b8172de-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Carbon Mass in Coarse Woody Debris
8b8172de-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Wood debris" means dead organic matter composed of coarse wood. It is distinct from fine litter. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent.

d22e279c-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.long_name: Carbon  in Above and Below-Ground Litter Pools on Land-Use Tiles
d22e279c-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.description: end of year values (not annual mean)

8b817e0a-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: subsurface litter pool fed by root inputs.

8b817892-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Surface or near-surface litter pool fed by leaf and above-ground litterfall

8b816d2a-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Carbon Mass in Vegetation Components Other than Leaves, Stems and Roots

baa8d49a-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.long_name: Carbon Mass in Products of Land-Use Change
baa8d49a-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Carbon mass per unit area in that has been removed from the environment through  land use change.

3e26d502-b89b-11e6-be04-ac72891c3257.long_name: Wood and Agricultural Product Pool Carbon Associated with Land-Use Tiles
3e26d502-b89b-11e6-be04-ac72891c3257.description: Anthropogenic pools associated with land use tiles into which harvests and cleared carbon are deposited before release into atmosphere PLUS any remaining anthropogenic pools that may be associated with lands which were converted into land use tiles during reported period. Examples of products include paper, cardboard, timber for construction, and crop harvest for food or fuel. Does NOT include residue which is deposited into soil or litter; end of year values (not annual mean).

e70578ba-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.long_name: Carbon Mass in Soil Pool Above 1m Depth
e70578ba-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.description: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

e7071b02-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.long_name: Carbon Mass in Each Model Soil Level (Summed over All Soil Carbon Pools in That Level)
e7071b02-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.description: for models with vertically discretised soil carbon, report total soil carbon for each level

8b7ed3d0-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Carbon Mass in Model Soil Pool
8b7ed3d0-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Carbon mass in the full depth of the soil model.

d22e1ea0-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.long_name: Carbon in Soil Pool on Land-Use Tiles
d22e1ea0-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.description: end of year values (not annual mean)

e7071f58-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.long_name: Carbon Mass in Each Model Soil Pool (Summed over Vertical Levels)
e7071f58-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.description: For models with multiple soil carbon pools, report each pool here. If models also have vertical discretisation these should be aggregated

baa90258-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Carbon mass per unit area in vegetation.

e706fac8-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.long_name: Carbon Mass in Vegetation on Grass Tiles
e706fac8-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Vegetation" means any plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. Plants are autotrophs i.e. "producers" of biomass using carbon obtained from carbon dioxide.

e706f654-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.long_name: Carbon Mass in Vegetation on Shrub Tiles
e706f654-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Vegetation" means any plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. Plants are autotrophs i.e. "producers" of biomass using carbon obtained from carbon dioxide.

e706f1cc-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.long_name: Carbon Mass in Vegetation on Tree Tiles
e706f1cc-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Vegetation" means any plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. Plants are autotrophs i.e. "producers" of biomass using carbon obtained from carbon dioxide.

d22e2328-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.long_name: Carbon in Vegetation on Land-Use Tiles
d22e2328-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.description: end of year values (not annual mean)

baab87f8-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by crop.

fb017ce4-be37-11e6-bac1-5404a60d96b5.description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by crop.

8b81522c-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C3 crops

6f6a8ea8-9acb-11e6-b7ee-ac72891c3257.description: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C4 crops

83bbfb99-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Depth of Lake Below the Surface
83bbfb99-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Depth of lakes, if this quantity is present in the model. If computed via volume and area, then this is lake volume divided by lake area.

83bbfb98-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Total (Cumulative) Thickness of All Soil Layers
83bbfb98-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Total (cumulative) thickness of all soil layers. This is the sum of individual thicknesses of all soil layers.

d2282aa4-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.description: The flux due to conversion of liquid or solid water into vapor at the surface where there is snow on land

6f68edb4-9acb-11e6-b7ee-ac72891c3257.description: at surface; potential flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)

83bbfbb0-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Water evaporation flux from soil but for daily averages i.e., the evspsblsoi variable, which is only currently defined for monthly averages

baad6596-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: the canopy evaporation+sublimation (if present in model).

83bbfbaf-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: The same as the current variable evspsblveg but defined on daily timescales.

8b8098b4-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation, Litter or Soil Pools into the Atmosphere Due to any Human Activity [kgC m-2 s-1]
8b8098b4-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Anthropogenic flux of carbon as carbon dioxide into the atmosphere. That is, emissions influenced, caused, or created by human activity. Anthropogenic emission of carbon dioxide includes fossil fuel use, cement production, agricultural burning and sources associated with anthropogenic land use change, except forest regrowth.

8b80db30-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: The fixation (uptake of nitrogen gas directly from the atmosphere) of nitrogen due to biological processes.

8b807604-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Lateral Transfer of Carbon out of Grid Cell That Eventually Goes into Ocean
8b807604-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: leached carbon etc that goes into run off or river routing and finds its way into ocean should be reported here.

8b81caea-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Deforested Biomass That Goes into Atmosphere as a Result of Anthropogenic Land-Use Change [kgC m-2 s-1]
8b81caea-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it should be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.

8b809ea4-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Deforested Biomass That Goes into Product Pool as a Result of Anthropogenic Land-Use Change
8b809ea4-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it should be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.

baad7f22-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from Fire Excluding Land-Use Change [kgC m-2 s-1]
baad7f22-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: CO2 emissions (expressed as a carbon mass flux) from natural fires + human ignition fires as calculated by the fire module of the DGVM, but excluding any CO2 flux from fire included in fLuc, defined below (CO2 Flux to Atmosphere from Land Use Change).

8b819a48-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from Fire Including All Sources [kgC m-2 s-1]
8b819a48-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: From all sources,  Including natural, anthropogenic and Land-use change. Only total fire emissions can be compared to observations.

8b808d56-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from Natural Fire [kgC m-2 s-1]

8b81c54a-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Harvested Biomass That Goes Straight into Atmosphere as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
8b81c54a-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: any harvested carbon that is assumed to decompose immediately into the atmosphere is reported here

80ab729f-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.long_name: Harvested Biomass That Goes into Geological Storage
80ab729f-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Flux of carbon harvested from biomass that goes into geologic storage for the purposes of intentional carbon dioxide removal, via efforts such as bioenergy with carbon capture and storage (BECCS) or biomass removal and storage (BiCRS). The definition of geologic storage here is that the resulting carbon be  stored for a period of time that is long relative to that of the simulation.

8b80a444-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Harvested Biomass That Goes into Product Pool
8b80a444-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: be it food or wood harvest, any carbon that is subsequently stored is reported here

8b819458-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux from Litter, CWD or any non-Living Pool into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from All Fire [kgC m-2 s-1]
8b819458-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Required for unambiguous separation of vegetation and soil + litter turnover times, since total fire flux draws from both sources

baad95d4-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Litter to Soil
baad95d4-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Carbon mass flux per unit area into soil from litter (dead plant material in or above the soil).

d229196e-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.long_name: Net Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Land-Use Change [kgC m-2 s-1]
d229196e-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.description: Net Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Land Use Change

3e26c210-b89b-11e6-be04-ac72891c3257.long_name: Carbon Transferred Directly to Atmosphere Due to any Land-Use or Land-Cover Change Activities [kgC m-2 s-1]
3e26c210-b89b-11e6-be04-ac72891c3257.description: This annual mean flux refers to the transfer of carbon directly to the atmosphere due to any land-use or land-cover change activities.  Include carbon transferred due to deforestation or agricultural directly into atmosphere, and  emissions form anthropogenic pools into atmosphere

6f6b608a-9acb-11e6-b7ee-ac72891c3257.description: Surface upward flux of nitrous oxide (N2O) from vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass), litter (dead plant material in or above the soil), soil.

e7068c5a-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.long_name: Nitrogen Mass Flux out of Land Due to any Human Activity
e7068c5a-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.description: will require some careful definition to make sure we capture everything - any human activity that releases nitrogen from land  instead of into product pool goes here. E.g. Deforestation fire, harvest assumed to decompose straight away, grazing...

8b80f0de-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Lateral Transfer of Nitrogen out of Grid Cell That Eventually Goes into Ocean
8b80f0de-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: leached nitrogen etc that goes into run off or river routing and finds its way into ocean should be reported here.

8b80f638-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Litter to Soil
8b80f638-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil.

8b8246d2-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. The phrase "expressed\_as" is used in the construction A\_expressed\_as\_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. "Nox" means a combination of two radical species containing nitrogen and oxygen NO+NO2. "Vegetation" means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil.

8b81025e-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Deforested or Harvested Biomass as a Result of Anthropogenic Land-Use or Change
8b81025e-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it should be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.

8b80eb66-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter
8b80eb66-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. "Vegetation" means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass.

8b80fc82-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil
8b80fc82-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: In some models part of nitrogen (e.g., root exudate) can go directly into the soil pool without entering litter.

8b80d5fe-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Dry and Wet Deposition of Reactive Nitrogen onto Land

e7067648-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.long_name: Total Nitrogen Added for Cropland Fertilisation (Artificial and Manure)
e7067648-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.description: Total Nitrogen added for cropland fertilisation (artificial and manure). Relative to total land area of a grid cell, not relative to agricultural area

8b8231e2-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Total Nitrogen Lost to the Atmosphere (Sum of NHx, NOx, N2O, N2)
8b8231e2-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Total flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere.

8b823c5a-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Total Nitrogen Lost to the Atmosphere (Including NHx, NOx, N2O, N2) from Fire
8b823c5a-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere due to fire

8b8237c8-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Total Nitrogen Lost to the Atmosphere (Including NHx, NOx, N2O, N2) from All Processes Except Fire
8b8237c8-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere due to all processes other than fire

8b822d82-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Total Nitrogen Loss to Leaching or Runoff (Sum of Ammonium, Nitrite and Nitrate)
8b822d82-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. The specification of a physical process by the phrase "due\_to\_" process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. "Leaching" means the loss of water soluble chemical species from soil. Runoff is the liquid water which drains from land. If not specified, "runoff" refers to the sum of surface runoff and subsurface drainage.

8b80d0cc-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Total Nitrogen Lost (Including NHx, NOx, N2O, N2 and Leaching)
8b80d0cc-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Not all models split losses into gaseous and leaching

8b80e602-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Net Nitrogen Release from Soil and Litter as the Outcome of Nitrogen Immobilisation and Gross Mineralisation
8b80e602-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Loss of soil nitrogen through remineralization and immobilisation. Remineralization is the degradation of organic matter into inorganic forms of carbon, nitrogen, phosphorus and other micronutrients, which consumes oxygen and releases energy. Immobilisation of nitrogen refers to retention of nitrogen by micro-organisms under certain conditions, making it unavailable for plants.

8b80e08a-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Total Plant Nitrogen Uptake (Sum of Ammonium and Nitrate) Irrespective of the Source of Nitrogen
8b80e08a-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: The uptake of nitrogen by fixation: nitrogen fixation means the uptake of nitrogen gas directly from the atmosphere.

8b8092e2-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Decomposition out of Product Pools to CO2 in Atmosphere as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
8b8092e2-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Flux of CO2 from product pools into the atmosphere. Examples of "forestry and agricultural products" are paper, cardboard, furniture, timber for construction, biofuels and food for both humans and livestock. Models that simulate land use changes have one or more pools of carbon that represent these products in order to conserve carbon and allow its eventual release into the atmosphere, for example, when the products decompose in landfill sites.

8b818ec2-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from All Fire [kgC m-2 s-1]
8b818ec2-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Required for unambiguous separation of vegetation and soil + litter turnover times, since total fire flux draws from both sources

baada4ca-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter
baada4ca-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. "Vegetation" means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. The sum of the quantities with standard names mass\_flux\_of\_carbon\_into\_litter\_from\_vegetation\_due\_to\_mortality and mass\_flux\_of\_carbon\_into\_litter\_from\_vegetation\_due\_to\_senescence is mass\_flux\_of\_carbon\_into\_litter\_from\_vegetation.

8b81a506-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter as a Result of Mortality
8b81a506-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality

8b819fac-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter as a Result of Leaf, Branch, and Root Senescence
8b819fac-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality

baadac22-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil
baadac22-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: In some models part of carbon (e.g., root exudate) can go directly into the soil pool without entering litter.

e7073696-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Soil as a Result of Mortality
e7073696-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.description: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality

e70731dc-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.long_name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Soil as a Result of Leaf, Branch, and Root Senescence
e70731dc-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.description: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality

d22e47d6-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.long_name: Annual Gross Percentage That Was Transferred into This Tile from Other Land-Use Tiles
d22e47d6-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.description: Cumulative percentage transitions over the year; note that percentage should be reported as a percentage of atmospheric grid cell

9157856a-267c-11e7-8933-ac72891c3257.long_name: Percentage of Grid Cell for Each Land-Use Tile
9157856a-267c-11e7-8933-ac72891c3257.description: End of month values (not monthly mean); note that percentage should be reported as percentage of land grid cell (example: frac\_lnd = 0.5, frac\_ocn = 0.5, frac\_crop\_lnd = 0.2 (of land portion of grid cell), then frac\_lut(crop) = 0.5\*0.2 = 0.1)

d22e4c68-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.long_name: Percentage of Grid Cell for Each Land-Use Tile
d22e4c68-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.description: End of year values (not annual mean); note that percentage should be reported as percentage of land grid cell (example: frac\_lnd = 0.5, frac\_ocn = 0.5, frac\_crop\_lnd = 0.2 (of land portion of grid cell), then frac\_lut(crop) = 0.5\*0.2 = 0.1)

d22e4358-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.long_name: Annual Gross Percentage of Land-Use Tile That Was Transferred into Other Land-Use Tiles
d22e4358-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.description: Cumulative percentage transitions over the year; note that percentage should be reported as percentage of atmospheric grid cell

baae7800-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Gross Primary Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
baae7800-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: The rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production.

e7076878-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.long_name: Gross Primary Production on Grass Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
e7076878-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.description: Total GPP of grass in the grid cell

e707633c-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.long_name: Gross Primary Production on Shrub Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
e707633c-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.description: Total GPP of shrubs in the grid cell

e7075e32-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.long_name: Gross Primary Production on Tree Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
e7075e32-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.description: Total GPP of trees in the grid cell

d22d8a9e-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.long_name: Gross Primary Production on Land-Use Tile as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
d22d8a9e-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.description: The rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production. Reported on land-use tiles.

83bbfbad-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Gross Primary Production on Vegetation type as Carbon Mass Flux
83bbfbad-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: The rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production. Reported on land-use tiles.

8b7f90fe-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Carbon-13 Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Gross Primary Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
8b7f90fe-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: The rate of synthesis of carbon-13 in biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production.

8b7f7826-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Carbon-14 Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Gross Primary Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
8b7f7826-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: The rate of synthesis of carbon-14 in biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production.

baae910a-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Percentage of entire grid cell that is covered by natural grass.

fb01755a-be37-11e6-bac1-5404a60d96b5.description: Percentage of entire grid cell that is covered by natural grass.

8b814764-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C3 natural grass.

8b814cc8-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C4 natural grass.

80ab71f9-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.long_name: Downward Heat Flux at Land Surface

d22dbe2e-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.long_name: Latent Heat Flux on Land-Use Tile
d22dbe2e-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface latent heat flux is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air on account of evaporation (including sublimation). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

d22dc374-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.long_name: Sensible Heat Flux on Land-Use Tile
d22dc374-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.description: Upward sensible heat flux on land use tiles. The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.

80ab7437-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: the total amount of irrigation water demand

80ab7439-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: the amount of water withdrawal for irrigation from ground water, including deep soil water, confined and unconfined aquifer, etc

3e26abc2-b89b-11e6-be04-ac72891c3257.long_name: Irrigation Flux Including any Irrigation for Crops, Trees, Pasture, or Urban Lawns
3e26abc2-b89b-11e6-be04-ac72891c3257.description: Mass flux of water due to irrigation.

80ab7436-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.long_name: Irrigation Flux Including any Irrigation for Crops, Trees, Pasture, or Urban Lawns
80ab7436-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: the total amount of water withdrawal from multiple sources

80ab7438-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.long_name: Irrigation water withdrawal from surface water
80ab7438-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: the amount of water withdrawal for irrigation from surface water, including rivers, lakes, reservoirs, etc.)

8b7ff4ea-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: A ratio obtained by dividing the total upper leaf surface area of vegetation by the (horizontal) surface area of the land on which it grows.

bab0919e-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: A ratio obtained by dividing the total upper leaf surface area of vegetation by the (horizontal) surface area of the land on which it grows.

d22dd6ac-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.long_name: Leaf Area Index on Land-Use Tile
d22dd6ac-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.description: A ratio obtained by dividing the total upper leaf surface area of vegetation by the (horizontal) surface area of the land on which it grows.

83bbfbac-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Leaf Area Index on Vegetation type
83bbfbac-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: A ratio obtained by dividing the total upper leaf surface area of vegetation by the (horizontal) surface area of the land on which it grows.

bab09a7c-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.long_name: Percentage of Area by Vegetation or Land-Cover Category
bab09a7c-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: The categories may differ from model to model, depending on their  PFT definitions.   This may include natural PFTs, anthropogenic PFTs, bare soil, lakes, urban areas, etc.   Sum of all should equal the fraction of the grid-cell that is land.

bab177b2-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: the total runoff (including "drainage" through the base of the soil model) leaving the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell, averaged over the 3-hour interval.

bab17cb2-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: computed as the total runoff (including "drainage" through the base of the soil model) leaving the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell.

bab17a6e-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: the total runoff (including "drainage" through the base of the soil model) leaving the land portion of the grid cell.

bab19ff8-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: the total surface runoff leaving the land portion of the grid cell.

8b800566-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Frozen Water Content of Soil Layer
8b800566-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: in each soil layer, the mass of water in ice phase.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea"

8b804774-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Frozen Water Content of Soil Layer
8b804774-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: in each soil layer, the mass of water in ice phase.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea"

8b800002-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Liquid Water Content of Soil Layer
8b800002-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: in each soil layer, the mass of water in liquid phase.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea"

6f6a36c4-9acb-11e6-b7ee-ac72891c3257.long_name: Liquid Water Content of Soil Layer
6f6a36c4-9acb-11e6-b7ee-ac72891c3257.description: in each soil layer, the mass of water in liquid phase.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea"

3c641b6c-b89b-11e6-be04-ac72891c3257.description: the mass per unit area  (summed over all soil layers) of water in all phases.

bab1a782-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: the mass per unit area  (summed over all soil layers) of water in all phases.

bab1c08c-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.long_name: Capacity of Soil to Store Water (Field Capacity)
bab1c08c-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: reported "where land": divide the total water holding capacity of all the soil in the grid cell by the land area in the grid cell;  reported as "missing" where the land fraction is 0.

80ab7435-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.long_name: Mean soil water content at a depth of 1 m

bab1ca14-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.long_name: Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column
bab1ca14-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: the mass of water in all phases in a thin surface soil layer.

bab1c85c-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.long_name: Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column
bab1c85c-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: the mass of water in all phases in a thin surface soil layer.

8b7ffa9e-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Total Water Content of Soil Layer
8b7ffa9e-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: in each soil layer, the mass of water in all phases, including ice.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea"

8b803cac-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Total Water Content of Soil Layer
8b803cac-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: in each soil layer, the mass of water in all phases, including ice.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea"

bab1c668-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.long_name: Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column
bab1c668-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: the mass of water in all phases in a thin surface soil layer.

d22ddb3e-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.long_name: Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column of Land-Use Tile
d22ddb3e-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.description: the mass of water in all phases in a thin surface layer; integrate over uppermost 10cm

6f6a4484-9acb-11e6-b7ee-ac72891c3257.description: requested for C4MIP, OCMIP/OMIP, LUMIP, ScenarioMIP, DECK, DAMIP, GeoMIP, LS3MIP, ??

6f6b1b5c-9acb-11e6-b7ee-ac72891c3257.long_name: Total Nitrogen in All Terrestrial Nitrogen Pools
6f6b1b5c-9acb-11e6-b7ee-ac72891c3257.description: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

8b81f60a-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area.

6f6b0a36-9acb-11e6-b7ee-ac72891c3257.description: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

8b820b04-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Coarse Woody Debris
8b820b04-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Wood debris" means dead organic matter composed of coarse wood. It is distinct from fine litter. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. The sum of the quantities with standard names wood\_debris\_mass\_content\_of\_nitrogen, surface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_nitrogen and subsurface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_nitrogen is the total nitrogen mass content of dead plant material.

bcc6ffa2-b8a7-11e6-b7f0-ac72891c3257.long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Below-Ground Litter (non CWD)
bcc6ffa2-b8a7-11e6-b7f0-ac72891c3257.description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Subsurface litter" means the part of the litter mixed within the soil below the surface. The sum of the quantities with standard names wood\_debris\_mass\_content\_of\_nitrogen, surface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_nitrogen and subsurface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_nitrogen is the total nitrogen mass content of dead plant material.

bcc6fc0a-b8a7-11e6-b7f0-ac72891c3257.long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Above-Ground Litter (non CWD)
bcc6fc0a-b8a7-11e6-b7f0-ac72891c3257.description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Surface litter" means the part of the litter resting above the soil surface. The sum of the quantities with standard names wood\_debris\_mass\_content\_of\_nitrogen, surface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_nitrogen and subsurface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_nitrogen is the total nitrogen mass content of dead plant material.

8b80cb4a-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: SUM of ammonium, nitrite, nitrate, etc over all soil layers

8b82154a-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: SUM of ammonium over all soil layers

8b821a7c-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: SUM of nitrate over all soil layers

8b8205b4-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Vegetation Components Other than Leaves, Stem and Root

8b80c06e-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Nitrogen Mass in Products of Land-Use Change
8b80c06e-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

8b80baec-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

6f6b0478-9acb-11e6-b7ee-ac72891c3257.description: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

bab23634-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Net Biospheric Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
bab23634-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: This is the net mass flux of carbon between land and atmosphere calculated as photosynthesis MINUS the sum of  plant and soil respiration, carbonfluxes  from fire, harvest, grazing  and land use change. Positive flux  is into the land.

d22da542-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.long_name: Net Carbon Mass Flux into Land-Use Tile [kgC m-2 s-1]
d22da542-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.description: Computed as npp minus heterotrophic respiration minus fire minus C leaching minus harvesting/clearing. Positive rate is into the land, negative rate is from the land.  Do not include fluxes from anthropogenic product pools to atmosphere

d2290cee-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.long_name: Net Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Net Ecosystem Productivity on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]

6f6b5004-9acb-11e6-b7ee-ac72891c3257.long_name: Net Mass Flux of 13C Between Atmosphere and Land (Positive into Land) as a Result of All Processes [kgC m-2 s-1]
6f6b5004-9acb-11e6-b7ee-ac72891c3257.description: Flux of carbon 31as carbon dioxide into the land. This flux should be reproducible by differencing the sum of all carbon pools (cVeg, cLitter, cSoil, and cProducts or equivalently cLand) from one time step to the next, except in the case of lateral transfer of carbon due to harvest, riverine transport of dissolved organic and/or inorganic carbon, or any other process (in which case the lateral\_carbon\_transfer\_over\_land term, see below, will be zero data).-

8b7f8b40-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Net Mass Flux of 14C Between Atmosphere and Land (Positive into Land) as a Result of All Processes [kgC m-2 s-1]
8b7f8b40-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Flux of carbon-14 as carbon dioxide into the land. This flux should be reproducible by differencing the sum of all carbon pools (cVeg, cLitter, cSoil, and cProducts or equivalently cLand) from one time step to the next, except in the case of lateral transfer of carbon due to harvest, riverine transport of dissolved organic and/or inorganic carbon, or any other process (in which case the lateral\_carbon\_transfer\_over\_land term, see below, will be zero data).

bab26690-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.long_name: Net Primary Production on Land as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
bab26690-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: "Production of carbon" means the production of biomass expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. Net primary production is the excess of gross primary production (rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors) by autotrophs ("producers"), for example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton, over the rate at which the autotrophs themselves respire some of this biomass. "Productivity" means production per unit area. The phrase "expressed\_as" is used in the construction A\_expressed\_as\_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A.

e70777e6-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.long_name: Net Primary Production on Grass Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
e70777e6-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.description: Total NPP of grass in the grid cell

e70772c8-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.long_name: Net Primary Production on Shrub Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
e70772c8-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.description: Total NPP of shrubs in the grid cell

e7076d96-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.long_name: Net Primary Production on Tree Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
e7076d96-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.description: Total NPP of trees in the grid cell

bab26e24-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.long_name: Net Primary Production Allocated to Leaves as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
bab26e24-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: This is the rate of carbon uptake by leaves due to NPP

d22d96ba-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.long_name: Net Primary Production on Land-Use Tile as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
d22d96ba-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.description: "Production of carbon" means the production of biomass expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. Net primary production is the excess of gross primary production (rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors) by autotrophs ("producers"), for example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton, over the rate at which the autotrophs themselves respire some of this biomass. "Productivity" means production per unit area. The phrase "expressed\_as" is used in the construction A\_expressed\_as\_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A.

e7074974-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.long_name: Net Primary Production Allocated to Other Pools (not Leaves Stem or Roots) as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

bab275d6-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.long_name: Net Primary Production Allocated to Roots as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
bab275d6-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: This is the rate of carbon uptake by roots due to NPP

e70740aa-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.long_name: Net Primary Production Allocated to Stem as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

83bbfba9-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Net Primary Production on Vegetation type as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
83bbfba9-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: "Production of carbon" means the production of biomass expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. Net primary production is the excess of gross primary production (rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors) by autotrophs ("producers"), for example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton, over the rate at which the autotrophs themselves respire some of this biomass. "Productivity" means production per unit area. The phrase "expressed\_as" is used in the construction A\_expressed\_as\_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A.

d5b3576e-c78d-11e6-9b25-5404a60d96b5.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. Altitude is the (geometric) height above the geoid, which is the reference geopotential surface. The geoid is similar to mean sea level.

d5b2df64-c78d-11e6-9b25-5404a60d96b5.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. Altitude is the (geometric) height above the geoid, which is the reference geopotential surface. The geoid is similar to mean sea level.

d5b42c98-c78d-11e6-9b25-5404a60d96b5.description: This is needed in case the ice sheet elevation changes in time

d5b3951c-c78d-11e6-9b25-5404a60d96b5.description: This is needed in case the ice sheet elevation changes in time

80ac31ae-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: height above the geoid; as defined here, "the geoid" is a surface of constant geopotential that, if the ocean were at rest, would coincide with mean sea level. Under this definition, the geoid changes as the mean volume of the ocean changes (e.g., due to glacial melt, or global warming of the ocean).  Reported here is the height above the present-day geoid (0.0 over ocean).

bab2f9d4-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: height above the geoid; as defined here, "the geoid" is a surface of constant geopotential that, if the ocean were at rest, would coincide with mean sea level. Under this definition, the geoid changes as the mean volume of the ocean changes (e.g., due to glacial melt, or global warming of the ocean).  Reported here is the height above the present-day geoid (0.0 over ocean).

bab30988-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.long_name: Percentage of Land Which Is Anthropogenic Pasture
bab30988-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by anthropogenic pasture.

e706daf2-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.description: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C3 pasture

e706df98-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.description: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C4 pasture

bab45658-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: the precipitation flux that is intercepted by the vegetation canopy (if present in model) before reaching the ground.

bab4c3ea-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
bab4c3ea-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to autotrophic respiration on land (respiration by producers) [see rh for heterotrophic production]

e70785c4-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.long_name: Autotrophic Respiration on Grass Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
e70785c4-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.description: Total RA of grass in the grid cell

e707816e-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.long_name: Autotrophic Respiration on Shrub Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
e707816e-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.description: Total RA of shrubs in the grid cell

e7077d0e-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.long_name: Autotrophic Respiration on Tree Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
e7077d0e-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.description: Total RA of trees in the grid cell

8b81b56e-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Total Respiration from Leaves as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

d22d91a6-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.long_name: Autotrophic Respiration on Land-Use Tile as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
d22d91a6-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.description: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to autotrophic respiration on land (respiration by producers) [see rh for heterotrophic production]. Calculated on land-use tiles.

e70755cc-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.long_name: Total Respiration from Other Pools (not Leaves Stem or Roots) as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

8b81ab0a-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Total Respiration from Roots as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
8b81ab0a-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Total autotrophic respiration from all belowground plant parts.  This has benchmarking value because the sum of Rh and root respiration can be compared to observations of total soil respiration.

8b81b046-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Total Respiration from Stem as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

83bbfba8-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Autotrophic Respiration on Vegetation type as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
83bbfba8-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to autotrophic respiration on land (respiration by producers) [see rh for heterotrophic production]. Calculated on vegetation type.

6f6b4384-9acb-11e6-b7ee-ac72891c3257.long_name: Carbon-13 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
6f6b4384-9acb-11e6-b7ee-ac72891c3257.description: Flux of carbon-13 into the atmosphere due to plant respiration. Plant respiration is the sum of respiration by parts of plants both above and below the soil. It is assumed that all the respired carbon dioxide is emitted to the atmosphere.

6f6b2c96-9acb-11e6-b7ee-ac72891c3257.long_name: Carbon-14 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
6f6b2c96-9acb-11e6-b7ee-ac72891c3257.description: Flux of carbon-14 into the atmosphere due to plant respiration. Plant respiration is the sum of respiration by parts of plants both above and below the soil. It is assumed that all the respired carbon dioxide is emitted to the atmosphere.

bab4f1e4-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.long_name: Percentage of Grid Cell That Is Land but neither Vegetation Covered nor Bare Soil
bab4f1e4-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: fraction of entire grid cell  that is land and is covered by "non-vegetation" and "non-bare-soil" (e.g., urban, ice, lakes, etc.)

fb018b80-be37-11e6-bac1-5404a60d96b5.long_name: Percentage of Grid Cell That Is Land but neither Vegetation Covered nor Bare Soil
fb018b80-be37-11e6-bac1-5404a60d96b5.description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is land and is covered by  neither vegetation nor bare-soil (e.g., urban, ice, lakes, etc.)

bab4f95a-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.long_name: Total Heterotrophic Respiration on Land as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
bab4f95a-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to heterotrophic respiration on land (respiration by consumers)

e70792da-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.long_name: Heterotrophic Respiration on Grass Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
e70792da-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.description: Total RH of grass in the grid cell

e7078e7a-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.long_name: Heterotrophic Respiration on Shrub Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
e7078e7a-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.description: Total RH of shrubs in the grid cell

e7078a24-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.long_name: Heterotrophic Respiration on Tree Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
e7078a24-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.description: Total RH of trees in the grid cell

8b81baaa-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Heterotrophic Respiration from Litter on Land
8b81baaa-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Needed to calculate litter bulk turnover time. Includes respiration from CWD as well.

d22da074-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.long_name: Heterotrophic Respiration on Land-Use Tile as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
d22da074-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.description: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to heterotrophic respiration on land (respiration by consumers), calculated on land-use tiles.

8b81bfe6-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Heterotrophic Respiration from Soil on Land
8b81bfe6-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Needed to calculate soil bulk turnover time

83bbfba7-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Heterotrophic Respiration on Vegetation type as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
83bbfba7-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to heterotrophic respiration on land (respiration by consumers), calculated on vegetation type.

8b7f9cde-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Carbon-13 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
8b7f9cde-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Heterotrophic respiration is respiration by heterotrophs ("consumers"), which are organisms (including animals and decomposers) that consume other organisms or dead organic material, rather than synthesising organic material from inorganic precursors using energy from the environment (especially sunlight) as autotrophs ("producers") do. Heterotrophic respiration goes on within both the soil and litter pools.

6f6b324a-9acb-11e6-b7ee-ac72891c3257.long_name: Carbon-14 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
6f6b324a-9acb-11e6-b7ee-ac72891c3257.description: Heterotrophic respiration is respiration by heterotrophs ("consumers"), which are organisms (including animals and decomposers) that consume other organisms or dead organic material, rather than synthesising organic material from inorganic precursors using energy from the environment (especially sunlight) as autotrophs ("producers") do. Heterotrophic respiration goes on within both the soil and litter pools.

bab5c7fe-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: report the maximum soil depth reachable by plant roots (if defined in model), i.e., the maximum soil depth from which they can extract moisture; report as "missing" where the land fraction is 0.

80aca269-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over land. Can be used for computation of surface albedo.

80ab7209-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.long_name: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over Snow
80ab7209-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over the portion of a land grid cell covered by snow but not by ice. Can be used for computation of surface albedo.

80aca26a-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over land. Can be used for computation of surface albedo.

80ab720a-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.long_name: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over Snow
80ab720a-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over the portion of a land grid cell covered by snow. Can be used for computation of surface albedo.

8bbb0fa8-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Percentage of grid cell covered by land ice (ice sheet, ice shelf, ice cap, glacier)

d5b46000-c78d-11e6-9b25-5404a60d96b5.description: This is needed in case the ice sheet area changes in time

d5b3c8e8-c78d-11e6-9b25-5404a60d96b5.description: This is needed in case the ice sheet area changes in time

bab73a76-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: fraction of grid cell occupied by "permanent" ice (i.e., glaciers).

83bbfb96-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Fraction of the Grid Cell Occupied by Lake
83bbfb96-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Fraction of horizontal land grid cell area occupied by lake.

bab76b9a-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by shrub.

fb017924-be37-11e6-bac1-5404a60d96b5.description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by shrub.

d2289714-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.description: Total liquid water storage, other than soil, snow or interception storage (i.e. lakes, river channel or depression storage).

d22dd206-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.long_name: Snow Water Equivalent on Land-Use Tile
d22dd206-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "lwe" means liquid water equivalent. "Amount" means mass per unit area. The construction lwe\_thickness\_of\_X\_amount or \_content means the vertical extent of a layer of liquid water having the same mass per unit area. Surface amount refers to the amount on the ground, excluding that on the plant or vegetation canopy.

80ac31e0-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Hourly Temperature at 2m above the surface

83bbfbbf-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Hourly Temperature at 2m above the surface

d22dae98-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.description: Air temperature is the bulk temperature of the air, not the surface (skin) temperature.

baba9752-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Transpiration (may include dew formation as a negative flux).

babab3ae-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: fraction of entire grid cell  that is covered by trees.

fb017168-be37-11e6-bac1-5404a60d96b5.description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by trees.

6f6a70da-9acb-11e6-b7ee-ac72891c3257.description: This is the percentage of the entire grid cell that is covered by broadleaf deciduous trees.

6f6a6a72-9acb-11e6-b7ee-ac72891c3257.description: This is the percentage of the entire grid cell that is covered by broadleaf evergreen trees.

6f6a6464-9acb-11e6-b7ee-ac72891c3257.description: This is the percentage of the entire grid cell that is covered by needleleaf deciduous trees.

6f6a5e4c-9acb-11e6-b7ee-ac72891c3257.description: This is the percentage of the entire grid cell that is covered by needleleaf evergreen trees.

d22db4d8-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.description: Surface temperature (i.e. temperature at which long-wave radiation emitted)

d227e094-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.description: Temperature of each soil layer.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea".

babb0732-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Temperature of each soil layer.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea".

babb0eb2-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.long_name: Surface Temperature Where Land or Sea Ice
babb0eb2-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Surface temperature of all surfaces except open ocean.

babb12ae-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.long_name: Surface Temperature Where Land or Sea Ice
babb12ae-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Surface temperature of all surfaces except open ocean, sampled synoptically.

6f6a57d0-9acb-11e6-b7ee-ac72891c3257.description: Percentage of grid cell that is covered by vegetation.This SHOULD be the sum of tree, grass (natural and pasture), crop and shrub fractions.

fb01828e-be37-11e6-bac1-5404a60d96b5.description: Percentage of grid cell that is covered by vegetation.This SHOULD be the sum of tree, grass (natural and pasture), crop and shrub fractions.

8b81da6c-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Vegetation height averaged over the grass fraction of a grid cell.

8b81e142-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Vegetation height averaged over the shrub fraction of a grid cell.

6f6ab46e-9acb-11e6-b7ee-ac72891c3257.description: Vegetation height averaged over the tree fraction of a grid cell.

6f6aafaa-9acb-11e6-b7ee-ac72891c3257.description: Vegetation height averaged over all vegetation types and over the vegetated fraction of a grid cell.

6f6b2106-9acb-11e6-b7ee-ac72891c3257.long_name: Grid Averaged Methane Emissions from Wetlands
6f6b2106-9acb-11e6-b7ee-ac72891c3257.description: Net upward flux of methane (NH4) from wetlands (areas where water covers the soil, or is present either at or near the surface of the soil all year or for varying periods of time during the year, including during the growing season).

8b822918-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Grid Averaged Methane Consumption (Methanotrophy) from Wetlands
8b822918-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Biological consumption (methanotrophy) of methane (NH4) by wetlands (areas where water covers the soil, or is present either at or near the surface of the soil all year or for varying periods of time during the year, including during the growing season).

8b8224ae-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Grid Averaged Methane Production (Methanogenesis) from Wetlands
8b8224ae-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Biological emissions (methanogenesis) of methane (NH4) from wetlands (areas where water covers the soil, or is present either at or near the surface of the soil all year or for varying periods of time during the year, including during the growing season).

6f6acb20-9acb-11e6-b7ee-ac72891c3257.description: Percentage of grid cell covered by wetland. Report only one year if  fixed percentage is used, or time series if values are determined dynamically.

d5b30bf6-c78d-11e6-9b25-5404a60d96b5.description: quantity averaged over ice sheet (grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only. Needed to analyse the impact of downscaling methods, and as forcing for ISM

8120cf70-bf17-11e6-b0d8-ac72891c3257.long_name: Ice Sheet Surface Mass Balance Flux
8120cf70-bf17-11e6-b0d8-ac72891c3257.description: quantity averaged over ice\_sheet (meaning grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

d5b2946e-c78d-11e6-9b25-5404a60d96b5.description: quantity averaged over ice sheet (grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only. Needed to analyse the impact of downscaling methods, and as forcing for ISM

d5b44890-c78d-11e6-9b25-5404a60d96b5.description: quantity averaged over ice sheet only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

d5b3b1aa-c78d-11e6-9b25-5404a60d96b5.description: quantity averaged over ice sheet only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

baa7f8ae-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the mass of snow on the land portion of the grid cell, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.  Reported as "missing in regions free of snow on land.

d2279224-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.long_name: Downward Heat Flux into Snow Where Land over Land

baaed890-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: the net downward heat flux from the atmosphere into the snow that lies on land divided by the land area in the grid cell; reported as missing for snow-free land regions or where the land fraction is 0.

d5b28910-c78d-11e6-9b25-5404a60d96b5.description: quantity averaged over ice sheet (grounded ice sheet and floating ice shelf) only. Needed to analyse the impact of downscaling methods

d5b43d14-c78d-11e6-9b25-5404a60d96b5.description: quantity averaged over ice sheet only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)

d5b3a606-c78d-11e6-9b25-5404a60d96b5.description: quantity averaged over ice sheet only, to avoid contamination from other surfaces (eg: permafrost)
