baa52de0-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: This may differ from "surface temperature" in regions of sea ice or floating ice shelves. For models using conservative temperature as the prognostic field, they should report the top ocean layer as surface potential temperature, which is the same as surface in situ temperature.

babb20b4-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: temperature of surface of open ocean, sampled synoptically.

baa71c7c-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Square of temperature of liquid ocean, averaged over the day.

baa53ee8-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Square of temperature of liquid ocean, averaged over the day.

80ac31e8-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: X-ward mass transport from residual mean (resolved plus parameterized) advective transport.

baa5942e-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: X-ward mass transport from residual mean (resolved plus parameterized) advective transport.

80ac31e9-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Prognostic x-ward velocity component resolved by the model.

baa586e6-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Prognostic x-ward velocity component resolved by the model.

83bbfc6f-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Daily surface prognostic x-ward velocity component resolved by the model.

80ac31ec-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Y-ward mass transport from residual mean (resolved plus parameterized) advective transport.

baa598c0-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Y-ward mass transport from residual mean (resolved plus parameterized) advective transport.

80ac31ed-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Prognostic y-ward velocity component resolved by the model.

baa58b1e-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Prognostic y-ward velocity component resolved by the model.

0d321850-1027-11e8-9d87-1c4d70487308.description: For oceans with more than 1 mesh (e.g. staggered grids), report areas that apply to surface vertical fluxes of energy. If this field is time-dependent then save it instead as one of your Omon and Odec fields

e0739eaa-e1ab-11e7-9db4-1c4d70487308.description: For oceans with more than 1 mesh (e.g. staggered grids), report areas that apply to surface vertical fluxes of energy. If this field is time-dependent then save it instead as one of your Omon and Odec fields

ebf66136-e1ab-11e7-9db4-1c4d70487308.description: For oceans with more than 1 mesh (e.g. staggered grids), report areas that apply to surface vertical fluxes of energy. If this field is time-dependent then save it instead as one of your Omon and Odec fields

babcc39c-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: For oceans with more than 1 mesh (e.g. staggered grids), report areas that apply to surface vertical fluxes of energy. If this field is time-dependent then save it instead as one of your Omon and Odec fields

47950696-bb0b-11e6-8316-5980f7b176d1.description: Total volume of liquid sea water.

baa503ce-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Total volume of liquid sea water.

83bbfc6e-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Daily surface prognostic y-ward velocity component resolved by the model.

baa65a76-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.long_name: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water
baa65a76-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: It is set to zero in models which receive a real water flux.

baa65eae-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: It is set to zero in models which receive a real water flux.

baa64df6-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.long_name: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water Due to Evaporation
baa64df6-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: zero for models using real water fluxes.

baa649d2-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.long_name: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water Due to Rainfall
baa649d2-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: zero for models using real water fluxes.

baa65224-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.long_name: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water from Rivers
baa65224-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: zero for models using real water fluxes.

baa65648-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.long_name: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water Due to Sea Ice Thermodynamics
baa65648-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: This variable measures the virtual salt flux into sea water due to the melting of sea ice. It is set to zero in models which receive a real water flux.

80ab741a-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

80ab744c-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

80ab741f-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the swell component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area). This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

80ab742c-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the swell component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area). This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

80ab7420-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the wind-sea component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., local wind waves). This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

80ab742b-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the wind-sea component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., local wind waves). This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

baa63dd4-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Computed as the water flux into the ocean due to flux correction divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

83bbfc5d-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Computed as the water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell. This is the sum \*wfonocorr\* and \*wfcorr\*.

baa63578-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Computed as the water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell. This is the sum \*wfonocorr\* and \*wfcorr\*.

baa58f74-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Upward mass transport from residual mean (resolved plus parameterized) advective transport.

This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

80ab744d-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves, by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

80ab7443-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the swell component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area), by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is typically expressed in degrees relative to true north.

80ab7444-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the swell component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area), by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is typically expressed in degrees relative to true north.

80ab7441-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the wind-sea component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., local wind waves), by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is typically expressed in degrees relative to true north.

80ab7442-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the wind-sea component of the wave energy spectrum (i.e., local wind waves), by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is typically expressed in degrees relative to true north.

80ab7410-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Wave period associated with the most energetic waves in total wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. In spectral wind wave models, this represents the spectral peak across the entire two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves.

80ab744e-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Wave period associated with the most energetic waves in total wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. In spectral wind wave models, this represents the spectral peak across the entire two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves.

80ab7421-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Wave period associated with the most energetic swell waves (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area). In spectral wind wave models, this represents the spectral peak across part of the two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating just swell waves.

80ab742e-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Wave period associated with the most energetic swell waves (i.e., waves that have propagated away from their generation area). In spectral wind wave models, this represents the spectral peak across part of the two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating just swell waves.

80ab7422-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Wave period associated with the most energetic wind-sea waves (i.e., local wind waves). In spectral wind wave models, this represents the spectral peak across part of the two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating just wind-sea waves.

80ab742d-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Wave period associated with the most energetic wind-sea waves (i.e., local wind waves). In spectral wind wave models, this represents the spectral peak across part of the two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating just wind-sea waves.

The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere.

In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. baa106c0-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due\_to\_process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase. 'Denitrification' is the conversion of nitrate into gaseous compounds such as nitric oxide, nitrous oxide and molecular nitrogen which are then emitted to the atmosphere.  'Sedimentation' is the sinking of particulate matter to the floor of a body of water. "tendency\_of\_X" means derivative of X with respect to time.

baa0449c-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: "Calcareous phytoplankton" are phytoplankton that produce calcite. Calcite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of calcite is CaCO3. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

baa03c54-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Diatoms are phytoplankton with an external skeleton made of silica. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

baa0406e-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: In ocean modelling, diazotrophs are phytoplankton of the phylum cyanobacteria distinct from other phytoplankton groups in their ability to fix nitrogen gas in addition to nitrate and ammonium. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

baa04cda-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Miscellaneous phytoplankton" are all those phytoplankton that are not diatoms, diazotrophs, calcareous phytoplankton, picophytoplankton or other separately named components of the phytoplankton population. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

baa048b6-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Picophytoplankton are phytoplankton of less than 2 micrometers in size. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

baa02ff2-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Growth limitation of calcareous phytoplankton due to solar irradiance. "Growth limitation due to solar irradiance" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

baa027a0-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Growth limitation of diatoms due to solar irradiance. baa02bc4-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Growth limitation of diazotrophs due to solar irradiance. baa03826-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: Growth limitation of miscellaneous phytoplankton due to solar irradiance. 80ac31dc-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.long_name: Surface Aqueous Partial Pressure of CO2
80ac31dc-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium. The partial pressure of a gaseous constituent of air is the pressure which it alone would exert with unchanged temperature and number of moles per unit volume. The chemical formula for carbon dioxide is CO2.

c92305ae-c5e8-11e6-84e6-5404a60d96b5.long_name: Mole Concentration of Mesozooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
c92305ae-c5e8-11e6-84e6-5404a60d96b5.description: carbon  concentration from mesozooplankton (20-200 um) component alone

c9186d38-c5e8-11e6-84e6-5404a60d96b5.long_name: Surface Mole Concentration of Microzooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
c9186d38-c5e8-11e6-84e6-5404a60d96b5.description: carbon  concentration from the microzooplankton (<20 um) component alone

83bbfb6b-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Mole Concentration of Microzooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
83bbfb6b-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: carbon concentration from the microzooplankton (<20 um) component alone

c91b3dba-c5e8-11e6-84e6-5404a60d96b5.long_name: Mole Concentration of Microzooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
c91b3dba-c5e8-11e6-84e6-5404a60d96b5.description: carbon  concentration from the microzooplankton (<20 um) component alone

c9188a3e-c5e8-11e6-84e6-5404a60d96b5.long_name: Surface Mole Concentration of Other Zooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
c9188a3e-c5e8-11e6-84e6-5404a60d96b5.description: carbon from additional zooplankton component concentrations alone (e.g. Micro, meso).  Since the models all have different numbers of components, this variable has been included to provide a check for intercomparison between models since some phytoplankton groups are supersets.

c91b5aa2-c5e8-11e6-84e6-5404a60d96b5.long_name: Mole Concentration of Other Zooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
c91b5aa2-c5e8-11e6-84e6-5404a60d96b5.description: carbon from additional zooplankton component concentrations alone (e.g. Micro, meso).  Since the models all have different numbers of components, this variable has been included to provide a check for intercomparison between models since some phytoplankton groups are supersets.

c917e0b6-c5e8-11e6-84e6-5404a60d96b5.description: sum of zooplankton carbon component concentrations

83bbfb6a-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: sum of zooplankton carbon component concentrations

ba9f57bc-e5dd-11e5-8482-ac72891c3257.description: sum of zooplankton carbon component concentrations

713aff10-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Evaporation and Sublimation
713aff10-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Rate of change of sea-ice mass change through evaporation and sublimation divided by grid-cell area. If a model does not differentiate between the sublimation of snow and sea ice, we recommend to report sidmassevapsubl as zero as long as the ice is snow covered, and to report any sublimation within the variable sisndmasssubl.

7109e6a0-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Mass of liquid precipitation falling onto sea ice divided by grid-cell area. If the rain is directly put into the ocean, it should not be counted towards sipr. Always positive or zero.

71401c0c-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Rate of change of snow mass due to solid precipitation (i.e. snowfall) falling onto sea ice divided by grid-cell area. Always positive or zero.

83bbfb40-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Downwelling Longwave Flux over Sea Ice
83bbfb40-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Downwelling longwave flux from the atmosphere to the sea-ice surface (energy flow per sea ice area). Always positive or zero.

710a7534-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Downwelling Longwave Flux over Sea Ice
710a7534-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Downwelling longwave flux from the atmosphere to the sea-ice surface (energy flow per sea ice area). Always positive or zero.

83bbfb3f-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Upwelling Longwave Flux over Sea Ice
83bbfb3f-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Upward longwave flux from the sea-ice surface to the atmosphere (energy flow per sea ice area). Always positive or zero.

71460f22-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Upwelling Longwave Flux over Sea Ice
71460f22-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Upward longwave flux from the sea-ice surface to the atmosphere (energy flow per sea ice area). Always positive or zero.

83bbfb3b-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Downwelling Shortwave Flux over Sea Ice
83bbfb3b-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Downwelling shortwave flux from the atmosphere to the sea-ice surface (energy flow per sea ice area). Always positive or zero.

713bf6d6-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Downwelling Shortwave Flux over Sea Ice
713bf6d6-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Downwelling shortwave flux from the atmosphere to the sea-ice surface (energy flow per sea ice area). Always positive or zero.

83bbfb3a-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Upwelling Shortwave Flux over Sea Ice
83bbfb3a-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Upward shortwave flux from the sea-ice surface to the atmosphere (energy flow per sea ice area). Always positive or zero.

710ad164-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Upwelling Shortwave Flux over Sea Ice
710ad164-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Upward shortwave flux from the sea-ice surface to the atmosphere (energy flow per sea ice area). Always positive or zero.

712fc2da-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Evaporation or Sublimation
712fc2da-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Rate of change of snow mass through sublimation divided by grid-cell area. If a model does not differentiate between the sublimation of snow and sea ice, we recommend to report all sublimation within sisndmasssubl as long as the ice is snow covered.

83bbfb25-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Total flux of salt from water into sea ice. This flux is upward (negative) during ice growth when salt is embedded into the ice and downward (positive) during melt when salt from sea ice is again released to the ocean.

83bbfb48-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Age of sea ice since its formation in open water.

80ac31d1-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Age of sea ice since its formation in open water.

712ebec6-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Age of sea ice since its formation in open water.

80ab725d-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Total integrated area of sea ice in the Northern Hemisphere (where siconc > 0). Does not include grid cells partially covered by land.

80ab725e-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Total integrated area of sea ice in the Southern Hemisphere (where siconc > 0). Does not include grid cells partially covered by land.

7132f446-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Total integrated area of sea ice in the Northern Hemisphere (where siconc > 0). Does not include grid cells partially covered by land.

7124f9a4-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Total integrated area of sea ice in the Southern Hemisphere (where siconc > 0). Does not include grid cells partially covered by land.

712442ca-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Net (sum of transport in all directions) sea ice area transport through the following four passages, positive into the Arctic Ocean. Note that the definitions of the passages are for SIMIP purposes just meant as default values as given by the physical ocean MIP described in Griffies et al. (2016). Individual models might chose slightly different definitions as given by their grid geometry. 1. Fram Strait: (11.5W, 81.3N) to (10.5E, 79.6N). 2. Canadian Arctic Archipelago: (128.2W, 70.6N) to (59.3W, 82.1N). 3. Barents Sea Opening: (16.8E, 76.5N) to (19.2E, 70.2N). 4. Bering Strait: (171W, 66.2N) to (166W, 65N).

71166880-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Computed strength of the ice pack, defined as the energy (J m-2) dissipated per unit area removed from the ice pack under compression, and assumed proportional to the change in potential energy caused by ridging. For Hibler-type models, this is P = P\* h exp(-C(1-A)) where P\* is compressive strength, h is ice thickness, A is compactness and C is strength reduction constant.

85c3e888-357c-11e7-8257-5404a60d96b5.description: Percentage of a given grid cell that is covered by sea ice on the ocean grid, independent of the thickness of that ice.

80ac31d2-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Percentage of a given grid cell that is covered by sea ice on the ocean grid, independent of the thickness of that ice.

86119ff6-357c-11e7-8257-5404a60d96b5.description: Percentage of a given grid cell that is covered by sea ice on the ocean grid, independent of the thickness of that ice.

d243b4a4-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.description: Percentage of a given grid cell that is covered by sea ice on the atmosphere grid, independent of the thickness of that ice.

71190054-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Percentage of a given grid cell that is covered by sea ice on the atmosphere grid, independent of the thickness of that ice.

714c1d90-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Sea-Ice Area Fraction Tendency Due to Dynamics
714c1d90-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Total rate of change in sea-ice area fraction through dynamics-related processes (advection, divergence, etc.).

711e985c-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Sea-Ice Area Fraction Tendency Due to Thermodynamics
711e985c-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Total rate of change in sea-ice area fraction through thermodynamic processes.

71436966-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Divergence of the Sea-Ice Velocity Field
71436966-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Divergence of sea-ice velocity field (first shear strain invariant). Requested as instantaneous value at the center of the month (i.e., first timestep of the 15th day of the month).

711e3862-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Total rate of change in sea-ice mass through dynamics-related processes (advection, divergence, etc.) divided by grid-cell area.

71190c48-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Basal Growth
71190c48-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Rate of change of sea-ice mass due to vertical growth of existing sea ice at its base divided by grid-cell area. Note that this number is always positive or zero since sea-ice melt is collected in sidmassmeltbot. This is to account for differential growth and melt in models with a sub-grid scale ice thickness distribution.

714ef880-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Snow-to-Ice Conversion
714ef880-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Rate of change of sea-ice mass due to transformation of snow to sea ice divided by grid-cell area. Always positive or zero.

71310690-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Growth in Supercooled Open Water (Frazil)
71310690-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Rate of change of sea-ice mass due to sea ice formation in supercooled water (often through frazil formation) divided by grid-cell area. Always positive or zero.

7129c466-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Bottom Melting
7129c466-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Rate of change of sea-ice mass through melting/dissolution at the ice bottom divided by grid-cell area. Note that this number is always zero or negative since sea-ice growth is collected in sidmassgrowthbot. This is to account for differential growth and melt in models with a sub-grid scale ice thickness distribution.

7124ed7e-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Lateral Melting
7124ed7e-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Rate of change of sea-ice mass through lateral melting/dissolution divided by grid-cell area (report zero if not explicitly calculated thermodynamically). Always negative or zero.

7124e0ea-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Surface Melting
7124e0ea-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Rate of change of sea-ice mass through melting at the ice surface divided by grid-cell area. This number is independent of the actual fate of the meltwater, and will hence include all sea-ice meltwater that drains into the ocean and all sea-ice meltwater that is collected by a melt-pond parameterisation. Always negative or zero.

7127bce8-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Total rate of change in sea-ice mass from thermodynamic processes divided by grid-cell area.

71375d1a-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: X-component of the sea-ice drift-induced transport of snow and sea ice mass.

714b47f8-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Y-component of the sea-ice drift-induced transport of snow and sea ice mass.

7142bf02-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Oceanic drag coefficient that is used to calculate the oceanic momentum drag on sea ice.

711ece62-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Atmospheric drag coefficient that is used to calculate the atmospheric momentum drag on sea ice.

71291d86-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Total volume of sea ice divided by grid-cell area, also known as the equivalent thickness of sea ice.

80ab725f-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Total integrated area of all Northern Hemisphere grid cells that are covered by at least 15% areal fraction of sea ice (siconc >= 15). Does not include grid cells partially covered by land.

80ab7260-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Total integrated area of all Southern Hemisphere grid cells that are covered by at least 15% areal fraction of sea ice (siconc >= 15). Does not include grid cells partially covered by land.

713a5c36-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Total integrated area of all Northern Hemisphere grid cells that are covered by at least 15% areal fraction of sea ice (siconc >= 15). Does not include grid cells partially covered by land.

7146a28e-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Total integrated area of all Southern Hemisphere grid cells that are covered by at least 15% areal fraction of sea ice (siconc >= 15). Does not include grid cells partially covered by land.

83bbfb44-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Mean height of sea-ice surface (i.e. snow-ice interface when snow covered) above sea level. This follows the classical definition of freeboard for in situ observations. In the satellite community, sometimes the total height of sea ice and snow above sea level is referred to as freeboard. This can easily be calculated by adding sisnthick to sifb.

714718d6-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Mean height of sea-ice surface (i.e. snow-ice interface when snow covered) above sea level. This follows the classical definition of freeboard for in situ observations. In the satellite community, sometimes the total height of sea ice and snow above sea level is referred to as freeboard. This can easily be calculated by adding sisnthick to sifb.

83bbfb43-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Net Conductive Heat Flux in Sea Ice at the Base
83bbfb43-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Net heat conduction flux at the ice base, i.e. the conductive heat flux from the centre of the lowermost vertical sea-ice grid box to the base of the sea ice (energy flow per sea ice area). Positive for a downward heat flux.

71402c4c-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Net Conductive Heat Flux in Sea Ice at the Base
71402c4c-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Net heat conduction flux at the ice base, i.e. the conductive heat flux from the centre of the lowermost vertical sea-ice grid box to the base of the sea ice (energy flow per sea ice area). Positive for a downward heat flux.

83bbfb42-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Net Conductive Heat Flux in Sea Ice at the Surface
83bbfb42-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Net heat conduction flux at the ice surface, i.e. the conductive heat flux from the centre of the uppermost vertical sea-ice grid box to the surface of the sea ice (energy flow per sea ice area). Positive for a downward heat flux.

711489d4-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Net Conductive Heat Flux in Sea Ice at the Surface
711489d4-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Net heat conduction flux at the ice surface, i.e. the conductive heat flux from the centre of the uppermost vertical sea-ice grid box to the surface of the sea ice (energy flow per sea ice area). Positive for a downward heat flux.

710b731c-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Total flux of fresh water from water into sea ice. This flux is positive when fresh water enters the ocean, and is therefore negative during ice growth and positive during ice melt.

7111a6e2-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Total flux of fresh water from sea-ice surface into underlying ocean. This combines both surface meltwater that drains directly into the ocean and the drainage of surface melt ponds. By definition, this flux is always positive.

83bbfb41-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Net Latent Heat Flux over Sea Ice
83bbfb41-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Net latent heat flux over sea ice (energy flow per sea ice area). Positive for a downward heat flux.

7127cbc0-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Net Latent Heat Flux over Sea Ice
7127cbc0-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Net latent heat flux over sea ice (energy flow per sea ice area). Positive for a downward heat flux.

83bbfb3d-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Net Upward Sensible Heat Flux under Sea Ice
83bbfb3d-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Net sensible heat flux under sea ice from or to the ocean (energy flow per sea ice area). Per sign convention, heat from the ocean is counted as negative since it describes an upward heat flux.

711fa92c-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Net Upward Sensible Heat Flux under Sea Ice
711fa92c-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Net sensible heat flux under sea ice from or to the ocean (energy flow per sea ice area). Per sign convention, heat from the ocean is counted as negative since it describes an upward heat flux.

83bbfb3e-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Net Downward Sensible Heat Flux over Sea Ice
83bbfb3e-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Net sensible heat flux over sea ice (energy flow per sea ice area). Positive for a downward heat flux.

712cccec-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Net Downward Sensible Heat Flux over Sea Ice
712cccec-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Net sensible heat flux over sea ice (energy flow per sea ice area). Positive for a downward heat flux.

83bbfb3c-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Downwelling Shortwave Flux under Sea Ice
83bbfb3c-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Downwelling shortwave flux underneath sea ice, i.e. the amount of shortwave radiation that penetrates the sea ice and reaches the sea ice-ocean interface (energy flow per sea ice area). Always positive or zero.

710a6936-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Downwelling Shortwave Flux under Sea Ice
710a6936-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Downwelling shortwave flux underneath sea ice, i.e. the amount of shortwave radiation that penetrates the sea ice and reaches the sea ice-ocean interface (energy flow per sea ice area). Always positive or zero.

714b545a-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Coriolis Force Term in Force Balance (X-Component)
714b545a-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: X-component of the force on sea ice caused by the Coriolis force divided by grid-cell area.

712a8130-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Coriolis Force Term in Force Balance (Y-Component)
712a8130-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Y-component of the force on sea ice caused by the Coriolis force divided by grid-cell area.

7147c57e-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Internal Stress Term in Force Balance (X-Component)
7147c57e-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: X-component of the force on sea ice caused by internal stress (divergence of sigma) divided by grid-cell area.

7112fc9a-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Internal Stress Term in Force Balance (Y-Component)
7112fc9a-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Y-component of the force on sea ice caused by internal stress (divergence of sigma) divided by grid-cell area.

71220f64-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Sea-Surface Tilt Term in Force Balance (X-Component)
71220f64-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: X-component of the force on sea ice caused by sea-surface tilt divided by grid-cell area.

710bfb0c-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Sea-Surface Tilt Term in Force Balance (Y-Component)
710bfb0c-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Y-component of the force on sea ice caused by sea-surface tilt divided by grid-cell area.

83bbfb38-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Heat content of all ice in grid cell divided by grid-cell area. This includes both the latent and sensible heat content contributions. Water at 0C is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J. This variable does not include heat content of snow, but does include heat content of brine in the sea ice. Heat content is always negative since both the sensible and the latent heat content of ice are less than that of water.

71492018-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Heat content of all ice in grid cell divided by grid-cell area. This includes both the latent and sensible heat content contributions. Water at 0C is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J. This variable does not include heat content of snow, but does include heat content of brine in the sea ice. Heat content is always negative since both the sensible and the latent heat content of ice are less than that of water.

83bbfb37-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Sea-Ice Area Percentage in Ice Thickness Categories
83bbfb37-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Percentage of grid cell covered by each ice thickness category (vector with one entry for each ice thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of the categories as third coordinate axis).

711b61dc-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Sea-Ice Area Percentage in Ice Thickness Categories
711b61dc-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Percentage of grid cell covered by each ice thickness category (vector with one entry for each ice thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of the categories as third coordinate axis).

83bbfb36-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Snow Area Percentage in Ice Thickness Categories
83bbfb36-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Percentage of grid cell covered by snow in each ice thickness category (vector with one entry for each ice thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of the categories as third coordinate axis).

71147dcc-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Snow Area Percentage in Ice Thickness Categories
71147dcc-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Percentage of grid cell covered by snow in each ice thickness category (vector with one entry for each ice thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of the categories as third coordinate axis).

83bbfb35-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Snow Thickness in Ice Thickness Categories
83bbfb35-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Actual thickness of snow in each ice thickness category, NOT snow volume divided by grid area (vector with one entry for each ice thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of categories as third coordinate axis). It can also be derived by dividing the volume of snow by the area of snow in each thickness category.

713fa34e-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Snow Thickness in Ice Thickness Categories
713fa34e-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Actual thickness of snow in each ice thickness category, NOT snow volume divided by grid area (vector with one entry for each ice thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of categories as third coordinate axis). It can also be derived by dividing the volume of snow by the area of snow in each thickness category.

83bbfb34-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Sea-Ice Thickness in Ice Thickness Categories
83bbfb34-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Actual (floe) thickness of sea ice in each ice thickness category, NOT volume divided by grid area (vector with one entry for each ice thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of categories as third coordinate axis).

712a1fc4-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Sea-Ice Thickness in Ice Thickness Categories
712a1fc4-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Actual (floe) thickness of sea ice in each ice thickness category, NOT volume divided by grid area (vector with one entry for each ice thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of categories as third coordinate axis).

714b603a-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Total mass of sea ice divided by grid-cell area.

7109b964-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Net (sum of transport in all directions) sea ice mass transport through the following four passages, positive into the Arctic Ocean. Note that the definitions of the passages are for SIMIP purposes just meant as default values as given by the physical ocean MIP described in Griffies et al. (2016). Individual models might chose slightly different definitions as given by their grid geometry. 1. Fram Strait: (11.5W, 81.3N) to (10.5E, 79.6N). 2. Canadian Arctic Archipelago: (128.2W, 70.6N) to (59.3W, 82.1N). 3. Barents Sea Opening: (16.8E, 76.5N) to (19.2E, 70.2N). 4. Bering Strait: (171W, 66.2N) to (166W, 65N).

83bbfb33-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Fraction of Sea Ice Covered by Melt Pond
83bbfb33-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Area fraction of sea-ice surface that is covered by melt ponds.

71238a60-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Fraction of Sea Ice Covered by Melt Pond
71238a60-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Area fraction of sea-ice surface that is covered by melt ponds.

80ab7261-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.long_name: Fraction of Sea Ice Covered by Effective Melt Pond
80ab7261-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Area fraction of sea-ice surface that is covered by open melt ponds, that is melt ponds that are not covered by snow or ice lids. This represents the effective (i.e. radiatively-active) melt pond area fraction.

80ab7266-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.long_name: Fraction of Sea Ice Covered by Effective Melt Pond
80ab7266-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Area fraction of sea-ice surface that is covered by open melt ponds, that is melt ponds that are not covered by snow or ice lids. This represents the effective (i.e. radiatively-active) melt pond area fraction.

83bbfb31-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Thickness of Refrozen Ice on Melt Pond
83bbfb31-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Volume of refrozen ice on melt ponds divided by melt pond covered area.

711b6ea2-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Thickness of Refrozen Ice on Melt Pond
711b6ea2-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Volume of refrozen ice on melt ponds divided by melt pond covered area.

83bbfb32-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Average depth of melt ponds on sea ice, that is melt pond volume divided by melt pond area.

7117858a-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Average depth of melt ponds on sea ice, that is melt pond volume divided by melt pond area.

83bbfb2f-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Area fraction of sea-ice surface that is ridged sea ice.

71342f78-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Area fraction of sea-ice surface that is ridged sea ice.

83bbfb2d-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Mean sea-ice salinity of all sea ice in grid cell. Sometimes, models implicitly or explicitly assume a different salinity of the ice for thermodynamic considerations than they do for closing the salt budget with the ocean. In these cases, the mean salinity used in the calculation of the salt budget should be reported.

7113f7b2-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Mean sea-ice salinity of all sea ice in grid cell. Sometimes, models implicitly or explicitly assume a different salinity of the ice for thermodynamic considerations than they do for closing the salt budget with the ocean. In these cases, the mean salinity used in the calculation of the salt budget should be reported.

83bbfb2c-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Mass of Salt in Sea Ice
83bbfb2c-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Total mass of all salt in sea ice divided by grid-cell area. Sometimes, models implicitly or explicitly assume a different salinity of the ice for thermodynamic considerations than they do for closing the salt budget with the ocean. In these cases, the total mass of all salt in sea ice should be calculated from the salinity value used in the calculation of the salt budget.

713cf6a8-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Mass of Salt in Sea Ice
713cf6a8-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Total mass of all salt in sea ice divided by grid-cell area. Sometimes, models implicitly or explicitly assume a different salinity of the ice for thermodynamic considerations than they do for closing the salt budget with the ocean. In these cases, the total mass of all salt in sea ice should be calculated from the salinity value used in the calculation of the salt budget.

713564ba-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Maximum Shear of Sea-Ice Velocity Field
713564ba-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Maximum shear of sea-ice velocity field (second shear strain invariant). Requested as instantaneous value at the center of the month (i.e., first timestep of the 15th day of the month).

7110e568-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Advection by Sea-Ice Dynamics
7110e568-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Rate of change of snow mass due to sea ice dynamics (advection, divergence, etc.) divided by grid-cell area.

714d7898-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Snow-to-Ice Conversion
714d7898-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Rate of change of snow mass due to transformation of snow to sea ice divided by grid-cell area. Always negative or zero.

712046d4-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Wind Drift of Snow
712046d4-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Rate of change of snow mass due to wind-driven transport into the ocean divided by grid-cell area.

83bbfb2a-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Heat content of all snow in grid cell divided by grid-cell area. This includes both the latent and sensible heat content contributions. Snow-water equivalent at 0 C is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J. Does not include the heat content of sea ice.

714e522c-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Heat content of all snow in grid cell divided by grid-cell area. This includes both the latent and sensible heat content contributions. Snow-water equivalent at 0 C is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J. Does not include the heat content of sea ice.

80ab7262-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.long_name: Snow Mass on Sea Ice North
80ab7262-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Total integrated mass of snow on sea ice in the Northern Hemisphere.

80ab7263-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.long_name: Snow Mass on Sea Ice South
80ab7263-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Total integrated mass of snow on sea ice in the Southern Hemisphere.

83bbfb21-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Snow Mass on Sea Ice North
83bbfb21-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Total integrated mass of snow on sea ice in the Northern Hemisphere.

83bbfb20-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Snow Mass on Sea Ice South
83bbfb20-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Total integrated mass of snow on sea ice in the Southern Hemisphere.

712fb3ee-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Net (sum of transport in all directions) snow mass transport through the following four passages, positive into the Arctic Ocean. Note that the definitions of the passages are for SIMIP purposes just meant as default values as given by the physical ocean MIP described in Griffies et al. (2016). Individual models might chose slightly different definitions as given by their grid geometry. 1. Fram Strait: (11.5W, 81.3N) to (10.5E, 79.6N). 2. Canadian Arctic Archipelago: (128.2W, 70.6N) to (59.3W, 82.1N). 3. Barents Sea Opening: (16.8E, 76.5N) to (19.2E, 70.2N). 4. Bering Strait: (171W, 66.2N) to (166W, 65N).

d243d86c-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.description: Speed of ice (i.e. mean absolute velocity) to account for back-and-forth movement of the ice.

71435d54-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Speed of ice (i.e. mean absolute velocity) to account for back-and-forth movement of the ice.

711afb3e-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Average Normal Stress in Sea Ice
711afb3e-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Average normal stress in sea ice (first stress invariant). Requested as instantaneous value at the center of the month (i.e., first timestep of the 15th day of the month).

7148170e-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Maximum Shear Stress in Sea Ice
7148170e-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Maximum shear stress in sea ice (second stress invariant). Requested as instantaneous value at the center of the month (i.e., first timestep of the 15th day of the month).

71147110-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: X-Component of Atmospheric Stress on Sea Ice
71147110-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: X-component of the atmospheric stress on the surface of sea ice divided by grid-cell area.

711858ca-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: X-Component of Ocean Stress on Sea Ice
711858ca-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: X-component of the ocean stress on the sea ice bottom divided by grid-cell area.

713aeca0-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Y-Component of Atmospheric Stress on Sea Ice
713aeca0-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Y-component of the atmospheric stress on the surface of sea ice divided by grid-cell area.

7132e85c-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Y-Component of Ocean Stress on Sea Ice
7132e85c-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Y-component of the ocean stress on the sea ice bottom divided by grid-cell area.

83bbfb29-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Mean temperature at the base of the sea ice, NOT the temperature within lowermost sea-ice model layer.

714b6c60-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Mean temperature at the base of the sea ice, NOT the temperature within lowermost sea-ice model layer.

83bbfb28-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Mean temperature at the snow-ice interface. This is the surface temperature of ice where snow thickness is zero.

711ec1d8-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Mean temperature at the snow-ice interface. This is the surface temperature of ice where snow thickness is zero.

d243ba76-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.description: Actual (floe) thickness of sea ice averaged over the ice-covered part of a given grid cell, NOT volume divided by grid area.

80ac31d5-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Actual (floe) thickness of sea ice averaged over the ice-covered part of a given grid cell, NOT volume divided by grid area.

d241a6d2-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.description: Actual (floe) thickness of sea ice averaged over the ice-covered part of a given grid cell, NOT volume divided by grid area.

83bbfb2e-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Total volume of ridged sea ice divided by area of ridges, i.e. mean thickness of ridged sea ice.

714c1192-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Total volume of ridged sea ice divided by area of ridges, i.e. mean thickness of ridged sea ice.

d243af0e-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.long_name: Fraction of Time Steps with Sea Ice
d243af0e-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.description: Fraction of time steps of the averaging period during which sea ice is present (siconc > 0) in a grid cell.

80ac31d6-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.long_name: Fraction of Time Steps with Sea Ice
80ac31d6-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Fraction of time steps of the averaging period during which sea ice is present (siconc > 0) in a grid cell.

714344cc-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Fraction of Time Steps with Sea Ice
714344cc-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Fraction of time steps of the averaging period during which sea ice is present (siconc > 0) in a grid cell.

b811a784-7c00-11e6-bcdf-ac72891c3257.description: X-component of sea-ice velocity on native model grid.

80ac31d7-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: X-component of sea-ice velocity on native model grid.

7147b8fe-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: X-component of sea-ice velocity on native model grid.

b811b062-7c00-11e6-bcdf-ac72891c3257.description: Y-component of sea-ice velocity on native model grid.

80ac31d8-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Y-component of sea-ice velocity on native model grid.

71237944-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Y-component of sea-ice velocity on native model grid.

80ab7264-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Total integrated volume of sea ice in the Northern Hemisphere.

80ab7265-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Total integrated volume of sea ice in the Southern Hemisphere.

712c4bd2-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Total integrated volume of sea ice in the Northern Hemisphere.

711edae2-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Total integrated volume of sea ice in the Southern Hemisphere.

7112255e-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Percentage of the sea-ice surface that is covered by snow. In many models that do not explicitly resolve an areal fraction of snow, this variable will always be either 0 or 1.

d243c0a2-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.description: Actual thickness of snow averaged over the snow-covered part of the sea ice. This thickness is usually directly available within the model formulation. It can also be derived by dividing the total volume of snow by the area of the snow.

80ac31d3-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Actual thickness of snow averaged over the snow-covered part of the sea ice. This thickness is usually directly available within the model formulation. It can also be derived by dividing the total volume of snow by the area of the snow.

714eec6e-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Actual thickness of snow averaged over the snow-covered part of the sea ice. This thickness is usually directly available within the model formulation. It can also be derived by dividing the total volume of snow by the area of the snow.

714129a8-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.long_name: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Melt
714129a8-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Rate of change of snow mass through melt divided by grid-cell area. Always negative or zero.

713ed766-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Total mass of snow on sea ice divided by grid-cell area. This then allows one to analyse the storage of latent heat in the snow, and to calculate the snow-water equivalent.

d243c692-4a9f-11e6-b84e-ac72891c3257.description: Mean surface temperature of the sea-ice covered part of the grid cell. Wherever snow covers the ice, the surface temperature of the snow is used for the averaging, otherwise the surface temperature of the ice is used.

80ac31d4-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Mean surface temperature of the sea-ice covered part of the grid cell. Wherever snow covers the ice, the surface temperature of the snow is used for the averaging, otherwise the surface temperature of the ice is used.

711075e2-faa7-11e6-bfb7-ac72891c3257.description: Mean surface temperature of the sea-ice covered part of the grid cell. Wherever snow covers the ice, the surface temperature of the snow is used for the averaging, otherwise the surface temperature of the ice is used.

83bbfba1-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: surface albedo at grid cell level (i.e. the albedo averaged over all potential subgrid-scale structures) over all wave-bands; this shall apply to all realms (land, ocean, sea ice, land ice)

83bbfba3-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: This is similar to Eday.albsn, but providing monthly averages

8b7eeef6-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Net Flux of CO2 Between Atmosphere and Land (Positive into Land) as a Result of All Processes [kgC m-2 s-1]
8b7eeef6-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Flux of carbon as carbon dioxide into the land. This flux should be reproducible by differencing the sum of all carbon pools (cVeg, cLitter, cSoil, and cProducts or equivalently cLand) from one time step to the next, except in the case of lateral transfer of carbon due to harvest, riverine transport of dissolved organic and/or inorganic carbon, or any other process (in which case the lateral\_carbon\_transfer\_over\_land term, see below, will be zero data).

80ab7204-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.long_name: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over Land Not Covered by Ice Sheets or Snow
80ab7204-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over the portion of a land grid cell not covered by ice sheets or snow. Can be used for computation of surface albedo.

80ab7206-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.long_name: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over Land Not Covered by Ice Sheets or Snow
80ab7206-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over the portion of a land grid cell not covered by ice sheets or snow. Can be used for computation of surface albedo.

80ab7449-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Average wave period (i.e., time in-between two wave crests) across the entire two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. In spectral wind wave models, it is calculated using spectral moments, mathematical measures that describe the shape and characteristics of the wave spectrum.

80ab7423-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Average wave period (i.e., time in-between two wave crests) across the entire two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. In spectral wind wave models, it is calculated using spectral moments, mathematical measures that describe the shape and characteristics of the wave spectrum.

80ab7200-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.long_name: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over Sea Ice
80ab7200-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over the portion of an ocean grid cell covered by sea ice, including snow. Can be used for computation of surface albedo.

80ab7201-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.long_name: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over Sea Ice
80ab7201-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over the portion of an ocean grid cell covered by sea ice, including snow. Can be used for computation of surface albedo.

80ab743a-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Average height of the highest one-third of waves present in the sea state, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. This is a key parameter for describing wave energy and is derived from the wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, this parameter is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the two-dimensional wave spectrum.

80ab7416-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Average height of the highest one-third of waves present in the sea state, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. This is a key parameter for describing wave energy and is derived from the wave spectrum using spectral moments. Specifically, this parameter is four times the square root of the integral over all directions and all frequencies of the two-dimensional wave spectrum.

80ab743b-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

80ab742a-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Mean direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

80ab7440-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves, by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

80ab743f-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Direction of wave propagation (direction from which the wave is coming) derived from the total wave energy spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves, by identifying the direction associated with the peak (maximum) energy density. This variable is usually expressed in degrees relative to true north.

80ab743c-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Wave period associated with the most energetic waves in total wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. In spectral wind wave models, this represents the spectral peak across the entire two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves.

80ab740f-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Wave period associated with the most energetic waves in total wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves. In spectral wind wave models, this represents the spectral peak across the entire two-dimensional wave spectrum, incorporating both wind-sea and swell waves.

8b7fad82-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon-14 as 14CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
8b7fad82-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Gas exchange flux of carbon-14 as CO2 (positive into ocean)

8b9817e6-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: These are standard variables from CMIP5.

83bbfbd3-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Shortwave radiation incident at the top of the atmosphere.

83bbfbd2-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Outgoing shortwave radiation at the top of the atmosphere.

8b981d36-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: The difference is to request greater vertical

8bae00ba-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).

8bae05ec-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).

8b982c22-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: wap is a lower priority request (level 2, not level 1)

8b8fbf42-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.

83bbfbd8-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Percentage of total cloud cover as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator.

ca7f7ade-6e00-11e7-9fbe-5404a60d96b5.description: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).

cad8979a-6e00-11e7-9fbe-5404a60d96b5.description: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).

83bbfbab-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: The total run-off (including drainage through the base of the soil model) per unit area leaving the land portion of the grid cell.

83bbfbaa-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Mean soil water content at a depth of 10 cm
83bbfbaa-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Soil moisture in the top 10 cm of the soil column

80ab7202-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.long_name: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over Ice Sheets
80ab7202-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation over the ice-sheet covered portion of a grid cell, including snow. Can be used for computation of surface albedo.

80ab7203-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.long_name: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over Ice Sheets
80ab7203-a698-11ef-914a-613c0433d878.description: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation over the ice-sheet covered portion of a grid cell, including snow. Can be used for computation of surface albedo.

83bbfb80-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T of 0.03 kg m-3
83bbfb80-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: Thickness of the layer bounded by the depth at which potential density Sigma0 exceeds density at 10m by 0.03 kg.m-3

3ea033746b2e830fcdadb54489c669ae0677d5f6.description: Surface Pressure .. needed for vertical coordinates

d6b53173f6bfd38172564d0e4a114cca518931dd.description: Surface Pressure .. needed for vertical coordinates

1aa81340-b006-11e6-9289-ac72891c3257.description: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

4795d5e4-bb0b-11e6-8316-5980f7b176d1.description: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

4795e390-bb0b-11e6-8316-5980f7b176d1.description: Contains contributions from all physical processes affecting the northward heat transport, including resolved advection, parameterized advection, lateral diffusion, etc. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.   Use Celsius for temperature scale.

4795f2d6-bb0b-11e6-8316-5980f7b176d1.description: Computed as the water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell. This is the sum \*wfonocorr\* and \*wfcorr\*.

47960082-bb0b-11e6-8316-5980f7b176d1.long_name: Downward Sea Ice Basal Salt Flux
47960082-bb0b-11e6-8316-5980f7b176d1.description: This field is physical, and it arises since sea ice has a nonzero salt content, so it exchanges salt with the liquid ocean upon melting and freezing.

47960e88-bb0b-11e6-8316-5980f7b176d1.long_name: Salt Flux into Sea Water from Rivers
47960e88-bb0b-11e6-8316-5980f7b176d1.description: This field is physical, and it arises when rivers carry a nonzero salt content.  Often this is zero, with rivers assumed to be fresh.

80b8a07e-1026-11e8-9d87-1c4d70487308.description: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

83bbfb61-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: The time varying thickness of the gridboxes computed on the t-points

83bbfb8a-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Downward Heat Flux at Sea Water Surface
83bbfb8a-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: This is the net flux of heat entering the liquid water column through its upper surface (excluding any "flux adjustment") .

83bbfb8d-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Water Flux into Sea Water from Rivers
83bbfb8d-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: computed as the river flux of water into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
83bbfb8d-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.history: Added in version v1.1 | Removed in version v1.2

83bbfc46-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: 6 hourly instantaneous eastward wind at 2 additional pressure levels in the UTLS region (175 and 225 hPa)

83bbfc65-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: In response to the opportunity "Accurate assessment of land-atmosphere coupling", I'm proposing a soil moisture for multiple layers in a frequency of 3hr.

8bafc508-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.long_name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Model Physics
8bafc508-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Heating rate due to diabatic processes

ab16e948-1026-11e8-9d87-1c4d70487308.description: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

ac26ebd6-bb0d-11e6-83c8-bf7187cdbd68.description: This is the net flux of heat entering the liquid water column through its upper surface (excluding any "flux adjustment") .

d4ba5dca-1026-11e8-9d87-1c4d70487308.description: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

4795ac40-bb0b-11e6-8316-5980f7b176d1.description: Prognostic x-ward velocity component resolved by the model.

4795b9ce-bb0b-11e6-8316-5980f7b176d1.description: Prognostic y-ward velocity component resolved by the model.

4795c766-bb0b-11e6-8316-5980f7b176d1.description: Prognostic z-ward velocity component resolved by the model.

83bbfb95-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: As snw but defined as Lmon (Not sure about this though - it seems already available as LImon but I'm guessing that's only over land ice?)

83bbfba4-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Surface Albedo of Ocean without Ice
83bbfba4-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: similar to the proposal of surface albedo of land without ice, but for ocean that is not covered by ice

83bbfba5-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.long_name: Surface Albedo of Land without ice cover
83bbfba5-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: albedo of the portion of land that is not covered by ice, potentially considering sub-gridscale inhomogeneity of ice cover

83bbfba6-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: This describes the albedo of any surface covered by ice, land and ocean

83bbfbb1-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: surface albedo at grid cell level (i.e. the albedo averaged over all potential subgrid-scale structures) over all wave-bands; this shall apply to all realms (land, ocean, sea ice, land ice)

83bbfbde-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: The depth of the 17°C isosurface of sea water potential temperature serves as the threshold for the survival of various fish species.

83bbfc1e-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: This is a band-average value for the surface albedo

83bbfc1f-7f07-11ef-9308-b1dd71e64bec.description: This is a band average value for the planetary albedo

8b81e674-4a5b-11e6-9cd2-ac72891c3257.description: Vegetation height averaged over the crop fraction of a grid cell.

e707a4e6-aa7f-11e6-9a4a-5404a60d96b5.description: Vegetation height averaged over the pasture fraction of a grid cell.
